title: Ratings360® Platform Specialist
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 09
  
**Job Title:** Ratings360® Platform Specialist
  
  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 9
  
  

**Location:** New York City
  
  

**About the role:**  

Ratings360 ® provides rated issuers with a holistic picture of their organization’s credit story – ratings, risk research and critical insights on one personalized dashboard. Issuers can also leverage the platform’s workflow capabilities such as requesting and tracking their rating requests or create hypothetical ‘what if’ scenarios via the credit scenario builder.
  
  

**Team :**  

Team will be externally focused, seeking ideas for new platform development and owning the voice of the customer. Working closely with the Global Commercial team, Data & Technology, Analytical, Legal, Compliance, as well as various external clients.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact:**  

Reporting to the Business Owner for Ratings360® within the Commercial Product Innovation and Development organization, the successful candidate will be responsible for:
  
  

Capturing the voice of the customer through product demos, attending Sales team meetings, and through feedback channels such as surveys and Salesforce call reports.
  
  

Creating partner relationships throughout the Commercial Product & Operations organization, and wider S&P Global Ratings Commercial team, to become recognized as a Ratings360® subject matter expert.
  
  

Effectively support internal stakeholders with demo preparation, functionality recap, sharing of product support material such as videos and user guides, roadmap walkthrough.
  
  

Identify opportunities for enhancing product roadmaps. Participate in organizing and setting priorities for enhancements.
  
  

Champion the OKRs and KPIs set for Ratings360®, be the expert for data collection and validation for such measures, prepare reporting for product leadership.
  
  

Key contributor to go-to-market campaigns for new functionality, includes communication plans, training, partnering with various groups including Product Management & Delivery, Marketing and Technology.
  
  

Embrace Agile SAFe framework, adopt the lens of a Business Owner to ensure business value is defined, measurable and understood.
  
  

Where required, support clients on new features and enhancements and work closely with Product Managers on feedback during post-launch process.
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

Preferred 2-3 years’ work experience in Financial Services , with 1-3 years relevant experience in Product or Platform development .
  
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
  
Eager to build a career in Product Innovation and Development, willing to embrace all facets of the role.
  
High energy and ability to work in fast-paced environment demonstrating a curiosity and drive with an innovative mindset.
  
Sense of urgency with a stakeholder service orientation.
  
Comfortable prioritizing competing demands where often items are very different in terms of technical detail and/or operational process.
  
Ability to collect and structure data for management OKR reporting.
  
Able to suggest process improvement and/or automation ideas.
  
Excellent communications skills, proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint ; client demos and internal presentations will be a core part of the role.
  
Organizational skills and ability to priorities activities based on client impact and business needs.
  
Ability to work effectively across teams, foster inclusivity, overcome resistance and navigate a complex organization.
  
Advanced problem-solving skills. Able to quickly identify and understand issues and drive towards effective resolution.
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information:** (This section is only applicable to US candidates)
  
  

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $49,400 to $98,200. Final base salary for this role will be based on the individual’s geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications.
  
  

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.
  
  

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .
  
  

About S&P Global Ratings
  
At S&P Global Ratings, our analyst-driven credit ratings, research, and sustainable finance opinions provide critical insights that are essential to translating complexity into clarity so market participants can uncover opportunities and make decisions with conviction. By bringing transparency to the market through high-quality independent opinions on creditworthiness, we enable growth across a wide variety of organizations, including businesses, governments, and institutions.
  
**S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE:** SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.
  
  

----------------------------------------------------------- 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), PDMGDV202.1 - Middle Professional Tier I (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority – Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning)

**Posted On:** 2024-08-30
  
**Location:** New York, New York, United States

title: Ice Cream Scooper/Cashier
description:
We are seeking a friendly and enthusiastic Ice Cream Scooper to join our team at a popular quick service fast food restaurant. As an essential part of our operations, you will play a vital role in ensuring that every customer leaves with a smile on their face. Currently seeking those with availability to help open the store and work a variety of weekday and weekend shifts.

\\*\\*Duties\\*\\*

- Greet and serve customers in a friendly and welcoming manner.

- Operate a cash register to process customer orders and manage transactions.

- Prepare and serve ice cream treats according to our menu.

- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen and dining area.

- Follow proper food handling and safety procedures to ensure a safe and healthy environment for our customers and staff.

- Provide assistance to customers with questions or concerns.

- Maintain a positive and professional demeanor at all times.

- Work effectively as part of a team to achieve our goals and objectives.

\\*\\*Skills\\*\\*

- Previous experience in the food industry, particularly in a quick service fast food restaurant.

- Strong knowledge of food safety and handling practices.

- Proficiency in operating a cash register and point-of-sale (POS) system.

- Excellent communication and customer service skills.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced kitchen environment and handle multiple tasks at once.

- Basic math skills to manage cash and operate a cash register.

- Familiarity with a kitchen environment and the ability to follow instructions.

- Availability to work a variety of shifts, including weekends and holidays.

- Ability to provide excellent help to customers and staff.

- A passion for working in the food industry and delivering exceptional customer experiences.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $15.13 - $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift

Application Question(s):

* Please provide the days/times you are available to work.

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)
* Night Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Cranford, NJ 07016 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Assistant
description:
**About us**

Dr. Cesare Saponieri, MD is a small business in Great Neck, NY. We are professional, agile, collaborative and our goal is to Make all of our patients feel cared for.

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* On-the-job training

\\*\\*Job Overview:\\*\\* We are seeking a compassionate and skilled Medical Assistant to join our dynamic healthcare team. As a Medical Assistant, you will play a vital role in delivering high-quality patient care in a fast-paced and patient-centered environment. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundation in medical terminology, with a passion for providing excellent care to patients of all ages, including geriatric patients. \\*\\*Duties:\\*\\* - Assist healthcare providers with patient care, including conducting vital signs, taking medical histories, and performing EKGs. - Prepare patients for exams, treatments, or procedures, including administering injections, medications, and inhaled treatments. - Handle administrative tasks, such as scheduling appointments, updating patient records, and managing inventory. - Provide patient education, including explaining diagnoses, treatment options, and aftercare instructions. - Work in a Level II Trauma Center setting, supporting emergency medical care and responding to emergencies as needed. - Assist with dermatology procedures, including skin biopsies and injections. - Collaborate with internal medicine providers to support the care of patients with chronic conditions. - Maintain a clean and organized environment, adhering to infection control and safety standards. - Perform tasks in an outpatient setting, with a focus on patient-centered care. \\*\\*Requirements:\\*\\* - High school diploma or equivalent required; medical assisting certification or degree preferred. - Strong knowledge of medical terminology and basic life support principles. - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks as needed. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work with patients of all ages, including geriatric patients. - Experience with coding and electronic medical records (EMRs) is a plus. - A commitment to providing high-quality patient care and a passion for staying up-to-date with the latest medical advancements. \\*\\*Skills:\\*\\* - Basic life support - Coding - Level II Trauma Center - Dermatology - Medical terminology - Geriatrics - Internal medicine - Inhale - Outpatient - Patient care

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Cardiology

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Medical terminology: 1 year (Required)

* Great Neck, NY 11021: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Trade Documentary Issuance Associate
description:
**Company Description**  

For more than 70 years, IDB Bank has made it our mission to be the best bank for our clients by putting their needs first, and the success we’ve enjoyed fundamentally comes down to our people. Here at IDB, you’ll work side by side with some of the most talented professionals in the industry who share a strong sense of teamwork and a passion for providing exceptional service down to the smallest detail. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous paid time off and the ability to participate in our medical coverage and 401(k) plan on your very first day with us. We are also committed to diversity and inclusion, and to providing all of our team members with an equal opportunity to succeed and make meaningful contributions within a work environment that is respectful, welcoming and inclusive.

 **Job Description**  

Responsible for issuing/amending/advising/transferring LC’s, issuing shipping guarantees/air releases as requested by customers and ensuring that LC/Compliance/Bank rules and regulations are adhered to.

**Job Description**

* Review incoming letters of credit and amendments.
* Prepare and enter new letters of credit and subsequent amendments on the automated system.
* Effect transfers and assignment of proceeds under existing Letters of Credit.
* Check completed transactions for quality and accuracy.
* Process charges representing commissions that are due to the Bank.
* Handle/resolve investigations as needed.
* Use a PC to retrieve previously entered transactions.
* Issue shipping guarantees and air releases.
* Ensure that all work performed is in compliance with the department‘s operations manual, all Bank policies and Regulatory requirements.

 **Qualifications**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Minimum of three years of letter credit import issuance experience.
* Thorough knowledge of the Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits, as well as the ICC Publication and all subsequent revision.
* Excellent word processing and communication skills.
* Ability to use a PC and an automated system.

 **Compensation**


The expected annual salary for this position is between $70,000 and $80,000 at the start of employment. A salary offer is determined on an individualized basis, taking into consideration factors such as an individual’s skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards package also includes eligibility for an annual bonus, medical, pharmacy, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, employee wellness program, retirement and savings plans with employer contributions, generous holiday and paid time off schedules, parental leave, and tuition reimbursement.

 **Additional Information**  

The Bank will make reasonable accommodations to the following employees to allow them to perform the essential functions of their position, except where doing so would result in undue hardship to the Bank:

* Those with a known mental or physical disability.
* Pregnant individuals and/or individuals with pregnancy or childbirth-related medical conditions.
* Victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.
* Employees with religious observance and practice obligations.


Any employee who believes he or she needs an accommodation for any of the above reasons should contact their supervisor or a member of Human Resources to request such an accommodation. In each case, the Bank will engage in a good faith written or oral dialogue concerning the individual’s accommodation needs; potential accommodations that may address the individual’s accommodation needs, including alternatives to a requested accommodation; and the difficulties that such potential accommodations may pose for the employer.


The Bank retains the ultimate discretion to choose the appropriate reasonable accommodation. Upon reaching a final determination at the conclusion of the cooperative dialogue, the Bank will provide the requesting individual with a written final determination identifying any accommodation granted or denied. In addition, the Bank will maintain any information regarding the employee’s request and status in the strictest confidence, except as requested by the employee, as required on a need-to-know basis or as otherwise required by law.

**Disclaimer**


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

***We are operating on a hybrid schedule.***

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE.***

title: Sales Representative
description:
Job Summary:

At Cypress Timber Windows & Doors, we specialize in delivering ultimate windows and doors solutions designed to enhance the functionality and aesthetics of both residential and commercial properties. Our commitment to exceptional products and outstanding customer service sets us apart in the industry.

We are seeking an ambitious and results-driven Sales Representative to join our growing company. As a key member of our organization, you will be responsible for generating new business leads and developing existing relationships with our customers. This role requires a strong sales background, excellent communication skills, and a keen ability to manage multiple accounts simultaneously. The successful candidate will be motivated by the opportunity to meet and exceed sales targets, and will thrive in a fast-paced, competitive environment. This is a heavy commission based role.

Duties:

* **Lead Generation:** Identify and pursue new business opportunities through networking, referrals, and direct outreach. Build and maintain relationships with potential clients, including homeowners, builders, architects, and contractors.
* **Sales Performance:** Achieve sales targets by presenting and selling our range of window and door products. Provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs and effectively handle objections to close sales.
* **Client Engagement:** Meet with clients to understand their needs, offer expert advice on our products, and ensure a high level of satisfaction throughout the sales process.
* **Consultative Approach:** Use a consultative sales approach to recommend the most suitable products and solutions, addressing any questions or concerns from customers.
* **Account Management:** Manage relationships with existing clients to encourage repeat business and generate referrals.
* **Product Knowledge:** Stay informed about industry trends, product features, and competitive landscape. Educate clients on product specifications and installation requirements.
* **Administrative Duties:** Prepare accurate quotes, process orders, and coordinate with our team to ensure timely delivery and fulfillment of services.

Skills:

* **Experience:** Previous sales experience is preferred, particularly in the windows and doors industry or a related field.
* **Skills:** Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships and influence decision-makers. Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* **Attributes:** Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work independently. Excellent problem-solving skills and adaptability to market changes.

**Compensation:**

* **Commission-Based Pay:** This role is purely but heavy commission-based, with no base salary or benefits. Earnings are directly tied to your sales performance. However, depending on the performance, this role has the potential to develop into a permanent full time position.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic group and develop your skills in a fast-paced, competitive environment. If you are a motivated sales professional looking for a new challenge, we encourage you to apply.

**How to Apply:**

If you are a driven sales professional seeking a flexible part-time role with significant earning potential, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your relevant experience to info@cypresswd.com.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

Cypress Windows & Doors is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Internship

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 20 per week

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Server/Waiter
description:
**Job Overview**  
Experienced Server and busboy needed for Senza Gluten By Jemiko an Italian gluten free restaurant in Hells Kitchen.

Our entire restaurant is completely gluten-free, so familiarity with gluten-free food, celiac disease, and food allergies is strongly preferred.

Our intimate restaurant is already became a favorite to locals and tourists seeking a delicious Italian meal minus the gluten.  
The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience in a full-service, fine dining restaurant.  
Food handler Certificate is a plus.  
Fluent in English preferred.  
We look forward to hearing from you.  
Walk-ins are acceptable Daily from Wednesday -Sunday from 3-pm-5pm Please ask for Sebastian.

**Duties**  
- Greet customers warmly and assist them in selecting menu items  
- Take food and beverage orders and relay them accurately to the kitchen staff  
- Serve food and drinks to guests in a timely manner  
- Handle cash and credit card transactions, ensuring accuracy in billing  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization of dining areas  
- Collaborate with kitchen staff to ensure efficient service

**Requirements**  
- Experience in the food industry is preferred  
- Proficiency in POS systems for order processing  
- Strong guest relations skills with a focus on providing exceptional service  
- Ability to handle cash transactions accurately  
- Basic math skills for order taking and billing  
- Knowledge of food preparation and fine dining etiquette  
- Excellent communication skills to interact effectively with customers

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $10.65 - $15.98 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Representative - Account Opening Team Leader
description:
**Company Description**  

For more than 70 years, IDB Bank has made it our mission to be the best bank for our clients by putting their needs first, and the success we’ve enjoyed fundamentally comes down to our people. Here at IDB, you’ll work side by side with some of the most talented professionals in the industry who share a strong sense of teamwork and a passion for providing exceptional service down to the smallest detail. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous paid time off and the ability to participate in our medical coverage and 401(k) plan on your very first day with us. We are also committed to diversity and inclusion, and to providing all of our team members with an equal opportunity to succeed and make meaningful contributions within a work environment that is respectful, welcoming and inclusive.

 **Job Description**  

Responsible for supporting and assisting Account Opening Manager as escalation point for internal staff, quality control and lead in account opening for Commercial, Domestic/International Banking accounts and KYC updates.

* Assist Manager and Commercial Banking and CA Private Banking teams with daily processing of customer information and requests by performing various customer service functions, ensuring timely, efficient, and accurate transaction execution.
* Serve as intermediary between Relationships Managers and all other departments within the Bank.
* Responsible for account opening for Lending with monitoring workload to ensure requests are carried out efficiently, accurately, and in compliance with regulatory standards.
* Responsible for guiding account opening staff with monitoring workload to ensure requests are carried out efficiently, accurately, and in compliance with regulatory standards.
* Effectively utilizes bank applications and case management tools (including dashboards) to prioritize tasks, and monitor progress to meet service level agreements.
* Reviews account opening packages to ensure it was prepared accurately and effectively to meet internal policies/practices, banking regulations, and compliance requirements.
* Establishes robust partnerships and open communication with the business, operations, and internal banking teams to effectively liaise, manage workload and help provide a white glove experience for our internal and external clients.
* Works closely with internal stakeholders, including Relationship Managers/Bankers, Compliance, Legal and IT, to ensure smooth account opening operations.
* Conducts training to keep the team updated on procedures, regulations and system enhancements.
* Participates in partnering with Account Opening Manager and partners to collaborate in achieving organizational goals and improved client services process.
* Responsible to multi-task by assisting clients/internal partners via various methods of communication (e.g. online application, phone, chat, in-person, email etc.)
* Utilizes problem-solving skills, sound judgement, creativity, and experience to analyze information to successfully resolve tasks and issues.
* Effectively handles the timing of communication and response to processing requests, providing instructions, scheduled training, bank projects, voicemails and emails for both internal partners and external clients to help contribute to our high-touch brand.
* Self-Starter that consistently approaches their work assignments with integrity, accountability, and consideration of the client and banks reputational risk which includes following compliance guidelines and company policies with a high level of care.
* Team player that participates in internal activities, testing and initiatives aimed at enhancing client experience, data integrity, optimizing workflows, case management processes etc.
* Participates and collaborates in cross-functional projects aimed at enhancing the client onboarding experience.

 **Qualifications**  

* 2-4 years of experience in Banking specifically related to account opening/onboarding and KYC updates.
* Passion for providing white glove customer service.
* Desire to be part of a team that strives to improve in how we process, deliver and service our clients, actively collaborates to get the job done, and contributes to a work culture that is harmonious.
* Self-starter with the ability to multi-task/prioritize workload to ensure timely, efficient and accurate execution.
* Bachelor Degree or transferrable experience for position.
* Excellent communication , problem-solving skills, and client skills.

**Compensation**


The expected annual salary for this position is between $85,000 and $95,000 at the start of employment. A salary offer is determined on an individualized basis, taking into consideration factors such as an individual’s skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards package also includes eligibility for an annual bonus, medical, pharmacy, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, employee wellness program, retirement and savings plans with employer contributions, generous holiday and paid time off schedules, parental leave, and tuition reimbursement.

 **Additional Information**  

The Bank will make reasonable accommodations to the following employees to allow them to perform the essential functions of their position, except where doing so would result in undue hardship to the Bank:

* Those with a known mental or physical disability.
* Pregnant individuals and/or individuals with pregnancy or childbirth-related medical conditions.
* Victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.
* Employees with religious observance and practice obligations.


Any employee who believes he or she needs an accommodation for any of the above reasons should contact their supervisor or a member of Human Resources to request such an accommodation. In each case, the Bank will engage in a good faith written or oral dialogue concerning the individual’s accommodation needs; potential accommodations that may address the individual’s accommodation needs, including alternatives to a requested accommodation; and the difficulties that such potential accommodations may pose for the employer.


The Bank retains the ultimate discretion to choose the appropriate reasonable accommodation. Upon reaching a final determination at the conclusion of the cooperative dialogue, the Bank will provide the requesting individual with a written final determination identifying any accommodation granted or denied. In addition, the Bank will maintain any information regarding the employee’s request and status in the strictest confidence, except as requested by the employee, as required on a need-to-know basis or as otherwise required by law.

title: OVERNIGHT SITTER With Creative IMAGINATION for ENERGETIC 4 year old
description:
For starters I'm only hiring women at this time it's a comfort level situation. I also DO NOT speak Spanish.

This is an OVERNIGHT POSITION for the hours of 5pm-630am 3 days a week. The start time is NOT flexible, my son has to be picked no later then 5pm from school, come 501 the school will charge a late fee if he's not picked up. So you have to be on time and have your own reliable transportation. Dinner time is 630, and bedtime is 930.

My son is not big on electronics, he has a very active imagination. This is where people tend to struggle the most you have to have a very unorthodox approach when trying to get him to engage. You'll need your imagination to the point you can talk to objects like their people and you'll have to be able to start up games without looking to him for participation. You'll have to have a high energy personalities that will draw him into what your game is, only then will he participate. If you try to directly engage him into the start of your game he won't be interested. The best methods to use are a reverse psychology approach combined with role play. Examples are saying loudly how no one is allowed in specific areas except for you and putting a guard to keep people out will draw him in. Another you voice that you hear something in the other room and when you check it out act out something you see and yell for help. If this is a skill set you can do definitely reach out.

When applying be sure to check your inbox the same day, I'll send you a message shortly after applying with further instructions.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 42 per week

Shift:

* Overnight shift

Experience:

* Babysitting: 1 year (Preferred)

* CPR Certification (Preferred)

title: Team Member
description:
***Team Member***

**About Pure Green:**

Pure Green is a leading juice bar company with a mission to build healthier communities around the globe by connecting people with superfoods. We specialize in handcrafted and made-to-order superfood smoothies, açaí bowls, and cold-pressed juices. Our team members are passionate about promoting a healthy lifestyle and providing exceptional hospitality to our guests.

**Job Description:**

As a Pure Green Team Member, you will play a crucial role in creating a positive guest experience by delivering excellent guest service and preparing our delicious superfood products. You will work closely with other team members to ensure smooth operations and maintain a clean and organized workspace.

**Responsibilities:**

* Read and understand Pure Green recipes to prepare high-quality superfood smoothies, açaí bowls, and cold-pressed juices.
* Adhere to food safety and quality control standards to ensure the finished products meet our high standards.
* Greet guests warmly, answer their questions, make recommendations, and accept orders and payments while providing exceptional hospitality.
* Clean and restock the workstation, including equipment sanitization, to maintain a hygienic environment.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure efficient workflow and problem-solving.
* Embrace a positive and enthusiastic attitude while working in a fast-paced environment.
* Follow company guidelines and protocols for maintaining a safe and healthy workplace.

**Benefits:**

* Tips: Opportunity to earn additional income through tips.
* Flexible Scheduling: We offer both full-time and part-time positions with flexible scheduling options.
* Free Shift Meals: Enjoy complimentary meals during your shifts.
* Discount on all products: Receive discounts on Pure Green products.
* Career Development: Clear career path with opportunities for advancement and professional growth.

**Requirements:**

* Engaging interactive skills and time resource management.
* Ability to work independently or as part of a team to solve problems and fulfill orders.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and able to handle multiple tasks efficiently.
* Strong teamwork and collaboration skills with a positive can-do attitude.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to provide exceptional hospitality.
* Commitment to upholding company standards and values.

**Additional Credentials:**

* Food Handlers Certificate
* Previous Café or Juice Bar experience
* Guest services

**Position Overview:**

As a Pure Green Team Member, you will be an ambassador of our brand and core values. Your role will involve direct guest interaction and upholding our hospitality standards. Reporting to the Shift Leader, Supervisor, Assistant General Manager and General Manager, you will have the autonomy to make decisions that enhance the guest experience. From greeting guests to preparing their orders and providing an uplifting cashier experience, you will be responsible for ensuring each guest leaves satisfied.

We value well-rounded team players who are willing to go above and beyond to ensure smooth store operations. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity take on different positions, fostering your professional growth within our organization.

To learn more about our company, please visit our website at puregreenfranchise.com.

“Pure Green provides equal opportunities to all individuals in terms of employment and applications, without discrimination based on sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.”

description:
Reporting to the VP of Sales, Education & Healthcare the Strategic Account Executive is a self-driven, results-oriented, sales professional with a positive outlook able to carry out sales activities to secure sales of our suite of products. Our clients are large Education systems, including universities, and Healthcare groups.
If you have excellent Sales skills, strong research and communication skills, and are great at networking, we would like to talk. Five years Sales experience selling software is a must; experience selling feeds and data is a plus. If you are an experienced B2B Enterprise Sales Solutions professional with experience selling into the Education and Healthcare space, we would like to talk to you.**Responsibilities:*** Uncover every potential opportunity in the Education and Healthcare space, using cold outreach and prospecting strategies
* Secure demonstrations to senior decision makers within an organization
* Respond to and follow up sales enquiries in a timely manner
* Close deals and see the process through to invoicing of contract value
* Regularly update relevant information on Salesforce CRM
* Achieving monthly sales targets on a cumulative basis
* Monitor and report on activities and provide relevant management information
* Liaise and attend meetings with other company functions necessary to perform duties and aid business and organizational development
* Attend training and to develop relevant knowledge and skills

**Required Qualifications:*** Five years experience working with and selling into the Education and Healthcare space
* Hard-working with a strong work ethic, consummate focused, hunter mentality
* Experience with SaaS products
* Understand the complex nature of CRM systems, the challenges surrounding their implementation and the integration of 3rd party data and software
* Ability to interact from C-Suite to Associate level required
* Very high presentation skills and exceptional face-to-face communication skills
* Have experience generating opportunities from cold call to close
* Excels at networking, setting up meetings and closing deals
* Positive attitude, strong work ethic, ability to work under pressure and independently

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Self-motivated with demonstrated success based on previous performance
* Effective, collaborative, consultative, and excited to connect the needs of our clients with our capabilities
* Motivated by the desire to constantly learn in a changing environment and actively contribute to a dynamic team structure

**About Altrata:**
Altrata is a global leader in people intelligence. It includes more than 100 million profiles on wealthy individuals around the world and more than 12 million profiles on senior decision makers, board members and c-suite leaders. Altrata provides intelligence on the people who are most impactful to our clients success.
Advanced integration solutions allow deeper insights and access to billions of connections helping clients close more deals, manage risk, and identify up and coming talent quickly. Our data is actionable, accurate, and comprehensive. Powered by a global team of more than 400 researchers who are committed to maintaining millions of profiles and changing data points, so you can effectively engage and make meaningful, lasting connections.
Altrata™ is a registered trademark of the Euromoney Group comprised of five distinct offerings: BoardEx, Boardroom Insiders, RelSci, WealthEngine, and Wealth-X.*Altrata is actively committed to promoting, fostering, and nurturing a diverse and inclusive environment, and all applicants will receive equal consideration regardless of race, sex, religion, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. title: Managing Director, Industry Solutions
description:
MongoDB's mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build anywhere—on the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, it's no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.



We are looking for the thought leader and technical expert in the particular vertical (e.g., Financial Services, Telecommunications) to join the CXO Advisory team. This part of the industry solutions organization is a fast-growing, globally-dispersed team working in an exciting space with nearly limitless opportunities of growth! Our team's members are the experienced practitioners and experts and work directly with the C-Suite of our clients around the application modernization and related strategies and at the same time, be able to work with customer developers and talk their language.



The Application Modernization Advisory team is the MongoDB expert community delivering thought leadership and practical directions for the legacy modernization and innovation of application stacks. This is NOT limited to database interactions but a holistic end to end view based on the experiences of the MongoDB team, including the full application stack. Generative AI is playing a key part in that - not only as a tool for modernization of legacy systems but turning a development organization towards the next challenges. The individual equally engages with clients and continues to evolve the approaches and concepts at the same time. The focus is on support for a well defined group of global enterprise clients that are closely aligned to the MongoDB Strategy. The team is very hands-on and the responsibilities range from supporting executive sales conversations, developing sales materials and training sales representatives and the wider sales community, advising customers on modernization strategies to providing senior leadership for individual modernization pilots and programs. At times, to ensure the success of customer projects, it will be necessary to dive into code to help provide technical direction. Superb communication skills including presentation skills are a paramount prerequisite. Past experience in software development and management of software is also required.



You'll work closely with a broad variety of functions inside the whole company, including sales,, professional services, product, and marketing. You will play a key role in winning deals and driving the business forward and will be a trusted advisor to a wide range of clients. The location for this role is quite flexible but needs to be in the New York region.


### **As an ideal candidate, you will have**


* 20+ years in a particular vertical (e.g., Financial Services, Telecommunications) in multiple areas (e.g,, for financial services,.Application Development "Change the bank", PTS, Risk & Treasury, Retail, Wealth management, commercial banking, Credit card operations and/or other areas)
* 15+ years of software development and architecture experience
* 10+ years of IT management experience including leading a development organization
* Deep experience working with various database products, ETL tools and related as well as database modeling and design
* Experience in transformation legacy environments (with backends such as Mainframe, DB2, Oracle PL/SQL) to modern microservice architectures
* Excellent presentation and communication skills with the ability to visualize and communicate complex information to all levels of an organization - both internally and externally
* Experience with scalable and highly available distributed systems
* Ability to discuss a broad range of data technologies ( non linear list: RDBMS, Java, document, key-value, unstructured, NoSQL, ISM.)
* The ability to travel up to 50% for clients, events, and the occasional team meetup

### **You may also have**


* Entrepreneurial spirit to work in a cross functional organization and getting things done
* MongoDB Certifications
* Cloud vendors Certifications in related fields
* Additional language skills in other languages (Conversational is appropriate)

### **What you do at MongoDB**


* You engage with the most senior leaders of our customers during their transformation journey:
+ Create buy-in into Modernization Factory
+ Advising customers on their transformation strategy
+ Design pilots for generative AI augmented transformations

* You partner with our sales team to help ensure success in accounts that are embarking on modernization programs
* You present MongoDB's position at various events - either in person or digital
* You help oversee and drive customer project delivery teams to success, able to detect and foresee technical problems and provide technical direction to resolve
* You are tightly aligned with our product management organization and communicate requirements from the field requirements to the product management leadership
* You demonstrate resilience and sound judgment in dealing with business challenges and are able to guide more junior colleagues to success
* You proactively seek opportunities to enable other parts of the MongoDB organization on modernization projects and programs
* You have situational awareness and react appropriately in group settings
* Enjoy the ride because we're growing fast!

### **What you will learn**


* Utilizing modern data backends for micro service architectures and design patterns
* AI-driven modernization
* Latest "art of possible" tool chains for driving transformations in IT landscape
* Market-relevant, complementary technologies e.g. Mistral, Fireworx, unqork,...
* Sales techniques and related soft skills - presentations, demonstrations, whiteboarding, discovery, objection handling
* Exposure to a wide variety of market verticals and a broad spectrum of interesting use cases.


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we're committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees' wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

title: Registered Nurse
description:
The New Brunswick Counseling center is seeking a full time position for a Registered Nurse for our Opioid Treatment Program.



The position primarily needs to work early morning hours and Saturdays.

  

NBCC is a CARF-accredited, non-profit organization that offers various services, including outpatient substance use and mental health services.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION**

  

NBCC is seeking a part-time qualified Registered Nurse candidate for our medication unit. This position reports to the Director of Nursing. In this role, the candidate must adhere to the program's goals and objectives regarding the patients and the patient's medical care. Essential duties of the position include but are not limited to:

  

* Perform nursing assessments on all new admissions or readmissions when necessary.
* Follow federal, State of New Jersey, and agency policies, including CFR 42.
* Review patients' prescriptions and OTC medications to ensure they are appropriately prescribed. Assess whether the client is aware of adverse reactions, and present them to the Medical Director for approval as appropriate.
* Administer/dispense methadone in accordance with New Jersey State and Federal regulations.
* Ensure that adequate recording of the administration/dispensing transaction has occurred.
* Perform, interpret, record, and report on-site TB tests and other testing as ordered by the physician.
* Record and report all observed symptoms and changes in the patient's condition to the interdisciplinary team members and medical director if necessary.
* Communicate patient status through legible and precise documentation.
* Make appropriate health referrals whenever necessary.
* Make appropriate requests to Medical Director when medication dosage change is indicated and carry out those orders accurately and promptly.
* Provide first aid to patients and staff as needed and make appropriate referrals as needed.
* Provide technical assistance to the staff in understanding a patient's medical problems.
* Maintain licensure as required and attend seminars, workshops, lectures, etc., to maintain professional growth.
* Keep the Medical Director informed of changes that occur in clinical and medical matters.

  


**Minimum Education and Experience:** Licensed in the state of NJ as a registered nurse (RN)

 **Special Requirements**: Ability to work independently and exercise discretion and own judgment.

 **Work Schedule:** Full-time position  

  

**License or certification:** Registered Nurse (RN) (Required)
company_description: Outpatient substance abuse and mental health treatment center.

title: Medical Assistant (NJ)
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:** Tribeca Pediatrics was founded by Dr. Michel Cohen, in 1994, and has grown into New York City's largest and most respected primary care pediatric practice. With over 40 locations in vibrant neighborhoods throughout the New York City metro area and New Jersey, we are truly the premier place to work and bring your family. Our incredible team of pediatricians, nurse practitioners, and medical support staff practices a unique philosophy that embraces low intervention, thoughtful medicine while delivering the highest quality of service and care.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION:** Tribeca Pediatrics Medical Assistants provide direct patient care to children in a clinical setting. They communicate with the pediatricians to provide a high level of service and care. Medical assistants are responsible for administering labs, screenings, drawing up vaccines and medications. They also maintain the medical inventory and supplies of the office and ensure a clean, functional and professional work environment. Customer service and a love for children is a must.

 **ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Patient intake, measure vital signs and record patient's chief complaint in the electronic medical record system
* Maintain a friendly, supportive and professional demeanor with patients and colleagues
* Administer, prepare, and send out Laboratory specimens and vaccines
* Perform in-office lab tests (i.e. strep testing, HGB, Lead, etc.)
* Perform routine screening tests and surveys such vision screening and hearing tests
* Schedule appointments
* Maintain office logs, vaccine and supply inventories
* Adhere to practice policies around HIPAA compliance and staff and patient safety
* Complete charts and tasks accurately and in a timely manner
* Potential assignment as a trainer after 90 day review. Training bonus offered.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**

  

* Previous experience in the medical field preferred
* Pre Med & CMA New Grads Welcome
* Warm and friendly customer service skills
* Time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work
* Open availability
* Must be able to provide proof of vaccination against Hep B, Tdap and MMR
* Must be available and present for entire training period (minimum 3 weeks)

  


**SALARY**


* Starting rate -$20.00/hour

  


**Supporting your career development:**

  

* Join a medical community of over 300 passionate providers & support team members
* Gain exposure in the medical and customer service field
* Potential assignment as a trainer after 90 day review. Training bonus offered.

  


**Benefits to support your health & wellness:**


* + After 90 days of employment, participate in competitive medical, dental and vision insurance plans paid for by Tribeca Pediatrics **or receive an additional benefit stipend of $600.00 per year**
* 401(k) Plan with 3% Safe harbor contribution from employer each year **(employees who are eligible will receive an immediately vested contribution each year even if they do not contribute themselves to their 401K plan)**
* Accrue up to 16 days of PTO/ year with the ability to roll over unused days
* Fully paid Gym Membership to select gyms in NYC and NJ
* Employee Assistance Program - Free confidential advice for team members who need help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues
* Pre Tax Commuter & Parking Benefit
* Additional medical coverage buy up available through Aflac
* Exclusive access to preferred pricing for Pet Insurance

  


**ENVIRONMENTAL/WORKING CONDITIONS**


* Clinical Office Environment

title: Director, Americas Public Finance - Housing
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 13
  
**The Team :** The US Public Finance Housing team covers a portfolio of about 600 ratings associated with housing finance agencies, public housing authorities, and community development finance institutions, along with analysis of rental housing bonds, capital fund financings, and federally-enhanced housing issues across the country. As a Director, you will participate in the management of a complex portfolio of credits and in market research and thought leadership efforts. If you have a passion for research, financial analysis, and housing affordability, you’d love this opportunity.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact :**  

As a Director, you will analyze a portfolio of assigned entities, assess clients’ financial projections, and resolve difficult deal-specific analytical situations. This position is responsible for meeting with issuers and investors on analytical matters, assisting in resolving client needs, contributing to media requirements in conjunction with other senior members of the organization, and taking the lead at external meetings related to credits. This role also entails internal leadership both in mentoring junior analysts and supporting in the overall leadership of the Housing team, in conjunction with the Analytical Manager, Sector Leads, and other Directors.
  
  

**Specifically, in this role, the analyst will:**  

Rate complex deals and proficiently write complex analytical reports.
  
  

Act as a senior member of rating committees and be responsible for convening and conducting of rating committee deliberations in Housing, including acting as the rating committee chair and assuring the integrity of the rating process. Act as an active, vocal voting member of the committee.
  
  

Function as a sector expert on credits. Publish timely industry commentaries, and proficiently write sector reviews and thought leadership pieces. Speak publicly and represent the company to external stakeholders. Identify and develop needed changes/innovations in rating methodology/criteria standards and the ratings process.
  
  

Manage, support and guide junior analysts and develop their analytical and personal skills. Review, critique, and provide analytic feedback on performance.
  
  

Embody a risk aware culture including leading by example, ensuring that analytical guidelines, quality standards, procedures and policies established are adhered to for all credits.
  
  

Lead operational and process improvements, maintaining a focus on both analytical excellence and a risk mindset.
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information:** (This section is only applicable to US candidates)
  
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $125,900 to $220,300 . Final base salary for this role will be based on the individual’s geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications.
  
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.
  
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:****Basic Qualifications:**  

Bachelor degree is required, postgraduate qualifications would be an advantage.
  
  

7+ years of experience related to the Public Finance sector.
  
  

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to coach and mentor analytical team members.
  
  

Propensity to show initiative and demonstrative proactive leadership
  
  

Strong communication (both written and oral) and influencing skills.
  
  

The aptitude to be a team player, balancing independent work.
  
  

The capacity and willingness to ensure that analytical guidelines, quality standards, procedures and policies established are adhered to for all credits.
  
  

**Additional Preferred Qualifications :**  

A deep understanding of the Public Finance sector, including expertise in Housing.
  
  

**Right to Work Requirements:**  

This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States.
  
  

About S&P Global Ratings
  
At S&P Global Ratings, our analyst-driven credit ratings, research, and sustainable finance opinions provide critical insights that are essential to translating complexity into clarity so market participants can uncover opportunities and make decisions with conviction. By bringing transparency to the market through high-quality independent opinions on creditworthiness, we enable growth across a wide variety of organizations, including businesses, governments, and institutions.
  
**S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE:** SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Account Executive, Northeast, NJ, PA, DMV
description:
**JOB TITLE:** Account Executive, Northeast NJ, PA, DMV  

**DETAILS:** Full Time  

**LOCATION: Northeast**  

**REPORTS TO: Regional Manager, East**

  

Dr. Barbara Sturm, one of the most sought-after aesthetic doctors in the world, drew on two decades of anti-inflammatory research and practice to create her high performance, ingredient science-focused skincare regimens. Her unique products have achieved cult status with skincare devotees worldwide, and her philosophy of healing the skin has challenged both aggressive approaches and the conventional wisdom.

  



Dr. Sturm has built more than a brand—she has built a lifestyle based on bettering oneself through education and self-care, focusing on your own beliefs and ambition and taking every challenge as an opportunity. Our community and customers are at the core of everything we do and their voices, opinions, and ideas inform each decision we make. Join us and become part of #TeamSturm.

  


**WHAT YOU WILL DO**  

The Account Executive is responsible for the achievement of sales objectives associated with their designated market. The Account Executive is responsible for their assigned team’s targeted growth, productivity and their overall impact on company profitability.

  


**A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE**


* Achieve or exceed sales plan for assigned territory.
* Communicate sales plan and goals to appropriate store personnel.
* Maintain VM standards.
* Develop and maintain strong brand relationships.
* Recruit, hire, train, monitor and schedule freelancers.
* Frequently travel to accounts within the region.
* Manage freelance budget and T&E budget within the region.
* Planning and execution of in-store events.
* Develop and maintain strong/active client base in partnership with each store. Make sure to follow retailer rules and guidelines.
* Conduct trainings during each store visit.
* Outreach to selling associates inside the cosmetic department as well as outside-i.e. top sellers, private clubs, stylists, etc.
* Submit a monthly action plan including trainings and major events strategized from retailer promotional calendar.
* Complete daily and weekly inventory assessments and provide feedback as needed.
* Conduct monthly business reviews with Department Managers to identify growth opportunities.

  


**YOUR AREAS OF KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE**


* Strong communication skills.
* Excellent attention to detail.
* Passion for Barbara Sturm.
* Travel required.
* Entrepreneurial drive & team oriented.
* A minimum of 4 years relevant experience.
* BA in Business or relevant field.

  



Candidates invited to interview will need to demonstrate their right to work in the US

  


*Salary: $85,000 - $90,000*

  


*Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. Dr. Barbara Sturm is an Equal Opportunities Employer. The company is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, gender, pregnancy, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, disability, medical history, skin colour, marital status, genetic information or parental status. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.*

title: High School Mental Health Program Coordinator
description:
Within our framework of a holistic, strength-focused, and family-supported practice, an individual hired as Program Coordinator of the Student Opportunities for Achievement and Readiness (S.O.A.R.) Program in the High School and College Success division will report directly to the Community School Director.  

**Education & Qualifications:*** Master’s degree in Social Work or Mental Health Counseling is required.
* LMSW preferred, SIFI certification is a plus.
* At least three(3) years working with adolescents in an urban environment providing mental health counseling services that reduces barriers and facilitate educational success and social emotional wellbeing.

 **Responsibilities:*** Develop and implement innovative programming for High School juniors and seniors with concentrations in areas of: Counseling, Social and Emotional Wellbeing, Life Skills, Healthy Relationships, College and Career Exploration.
* Supervise part time counselor advocates and provide them with ongoing feedback and support.
* Recruit program participants through classroom push-ins, attendance at school events, and referrals from school staff.
* Perform intake assessments, evaluate immediate needs, and formulate a treatment plan with students.
* Conduct individual and group counseling with students on a weekly basis.
* Provide academic advisement, goal setting, and individualized educational planning.
* Provide crisis counseling, conflict mediation and social-emotional support.
* Connect students and families with referrals for appropriate placements, community resources and treatment facilities when necessary.
* Communicate with families, administration, and teachers about strategies to best support students at home and at school.
* Work with the Community School Director on school wide initiatives to improve school culture and student engagement.
* Observe and communicate with staff to provide consistent, ongoing supervision and guidance to ensure that staff upholds the policies set forth by Commonpoint and the New York City Department of Education (DOE).
* Attend occasional evening and weekend events, as needed.
* Ensure that all participant files are accurate and kept current with documents, assessments, treatment plans, case notes, and interventions.
* Complete and maintain program data in tools provided by the funder (mid/end year reports) and the agency (weekly dashboard).
* Computer literate, including experience with all Microsoft Office software packages; Google Drive (Gmail, Calendar, Contacts, Docs, etc.); local area networks; and efficient use of the Internet.

  

**General Tasks of All Commonpoint Staff:*** Promote and implement the Core Values of the organization.
* Participation in all staff meetings and staff training seminars.
* Participation in agency-wide programs and program committees, as assigned.
* Active involvement, as a supervisee, in the supervision process.
* Support the mission of the organization.
* Other tasks appropriate to Commonpoint staff, as assigned.

  

Commonpoint reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.  

Commonpoint is an equal opportunity employers/program. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities.  

**To Apply:** Please submit a cover letter and résumé, as a Word or PDF document only, to **sjeancharles@commonpoint.org**. Please indicate “Program Coordinator - S.O.A.R. Program” in the subject line. **Due to the high volume of applicants, only qualified candidates will be contacted.**

title: Coordinating Mgr - L A
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Harlem Hospital Center has been a bedrock of the Harlem community since 1887. The hospital provides a wide range of medical, surgical, diagnostic, therapeutic and family support services to the residents of Central Harlem, West Harlem, Washington Heights and Inwood. Harlem is the largest hospital in the area, capable of treating the most seriously ill. Harlem provides over 90 specialized ambulatory care services, dentistry and oral surgery, behavioral health services, and community substance abuse treatment.

  

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


This class of positions encompasses supervisory or administrative work of varying degrees of difficulty and with varying degrees of latitude for independent initiative and judgment as follows: 1. For activities of professional and non-professional staff in delivering a health therapy program and support services including physical, occupational, inhalation specialties, radiological, laboratory, emergency, ambulatory care services, medical utilization review and quality assurance. 2. Coordinates rehabilitation services, as indicated so as to integrate these programs with other health care setting programs to maximize patient treatment and recovery. Coordinates, supervises and monitors medical utilization review and/or quality assurance programs for health care settings. 3. For planning, controlling, coordinating administrative and office operations and interpreting compliance with predetermined standards for quality care in a variety of organizational settings and modalities in the delivery of business, office and management support systems. Integrates, coordinates these programs, operations, functions and services with other health care settings and Central Office departments to optimal levels of performance in the administration and supervision of such functional activities.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


Assignment Level A  

Under general supervision with moderate latitude for independent initiative and judgment, performs some of the following functions:  

1. Consults with medical and professional staff of other departments and staff from associated health care fields to plan and coordinate joint patient and management objectives. Acts as a liaison between the Department of Medical Services and other administrative divisions.  

2. Provides administrative supervision for a program of comprehensive health service of professional and non-professional staff involving therapists, counselors and related health personnel.  

3. Plans, develops, and may conduct training programs to maintain proficiency of staff and use of new equipment and methods.  

4. Allocates staff on basis of workload, space, and available equipment.  

5. Participates in budgetary planning, reviews operating costs, performs cost studies and prepares department budgets.  

6. May supervise studies related to the service/program and analyzes modifications and development of systems and procedures to improve departmental operations. Makes recommendations and implements.  

7. Coordinates research projects and conducts special studies to evaluate various rehabilitative programs in the department and within the overall objective of the department.  

8. Directs the processing of medically prescribed orders for requisitioning of equipment, prosthetic appliances, and medical supplies for patients.  

9. As required, consults with medical, nursing and other staff involved in treatment to clarify ambiguities and secure documentation of the records and to secure necessary and timely certification and verification.

  

**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling; and


2. Two (2) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, one (1) year of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician; or two (2) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including one (1) year in a supervisory or administrative capacity; or


3. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines listed in “1” above; and


4. Three (3) years of full-time experience, as described in “2” above, including two (2) years of experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations, as listed in “2” above; or


5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

  

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:  

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
